page.title: 05FARMING IN THE EDGMOND AREA
page.content: Since Britain joined the{E.E.C. {farming}in{Edgmond}has not altered to a great extent. Basically the same {crops}are grown, but with guaranteed prices now in existance it pays to over produce. This is the reason for the vast Butter, Milk and Grain Mountains. Previously Wheat and Sugar-Beet were the principle crops grown, but more recently - over the past five years - Oil-Seed Rape and Peas are produced on a greater scale. As in many other areas, much larger fields are now apparent due to hedge removal as a result, much wildlife has been destroyed, which is a great pity. The developments which have most influenced farming in the area in the last 3 decadesare, the Breeding of new Plant Varieties, Herbicides to control weed growth and - in the last decade - Phangicides to Prevent Disease.
